intro: Calochortus fimbriatus, commonly known as the fringed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its showy, showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Calochortus fimbriatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
